title: prehistory_end
body: Prehistory end

title: email0_1
body: Hi, I've heard a lot about you on the hacker forum and would like to offer you a task, for a generous reward, of course.

title: email0_2
body: There is one large company "Metam" and they have their new secret development on the main server because of which they can seize power over ordinary Internet users.

title: email0_3
body: So, the essence of the task: I do not need any files from their server, even more - I only ask you to slightly change the config in their new development so that an unexpected bug appears and they would not have time to release the program and we had some time, to get admin access to their backup servers. I only ask you, do not delete anything from the server yourself, because of this they will be able to quickly track you down. All useful software and, just in case, a manual will be sent to you by my colleague after a while. Good luck!

title: email0_4
body: Metam master server IP - 250.154.131.22

title: email1_1
body: Hi, all useful software is on this FTP server in the home/www directory

title: email1_2
body: Note: To download files from FTP server use command in terminal wget [ip]/[directory]

title: email2_1
body: I see that you have downloaded all the necessary software from the server, now you are officially on our team.

title: email2_2
body: Now I can introduce myself, I am Kirin. Of course it's not my real name, it's a nickname to make it harder for Metam to figure out me.

title: email2_3
body: So, I found out that the main server has an improved firewall, which requires a 50-character password to bypass it, so brute-force is not an option.

title: email2_4
body: But one of their non-main web servers has minimal protection, hack it and view the files, you may find something useful.

title: email2_5
body: Contact my gmail userbot to get documentation for the downloaded utilities. The mechanism for hacking servers is almost always the same: We scan the server for ports, break them and use the porthack utility to connect. It's simple, right?

title: email2_7
body: IP address of the first Metam web server: 99.179.21.125

title: email2_6
body: Email address: kirinbot1@userbot.com

title: email2_8
body: Write a message via gmail: gmail [email]

title: email3_1
body: Re: Documentation on using the utilities.

title: email3_2
body: nmap [ip] – Scan the server for ports.

title: email3_3
body: porthack – Connecting to the server using hacked ports.

title: email3_4
body: analyze – Brute-force bypass password firewall.

title: email3_5
body: solve [пароль] – Bypassing the firewall using a password.

title: email3_6
body: smc [port] – Hacking the database.

title: email3_7
body: sshcrack [port] – Port hacking ssh

title: email3_8
body: Copyright (c) Kirin and CoolHacker2000.

title: email4_1
body: Hi, how is the work progressing? If something doesn't work out, don't worry - try again.

title: email4_2
body: And by the way, keep the documentation, it's up to you to use it or not.

title: email4_3
body: Documentation for Linux #1:

title: email4_4
body: ls – List directories

title: email4_5
body: cd [catalog] – Go to catalog

title: email4_6
body: cat [file] – View file content

title: email4_7
body: scp [file] – Upload a file from the server to your home directory

title: email4_8
body: Find something interesting and upload it to your home directory. Good luck!

title: email5_1
body: N2C3h4k2Ms? Hmm ... Looks like this is what you need.

title: email5_2
body: Now try to hack the main server, but before that, still bypass firewall.

title: email5_3
body: If you forgot something - all the documentation is in the mail.
